issue.title: Stringstreams read/write pointers initial position unclear

discussion.p: In a comp.lang.c++.moderated Matthias Mueller wrote:
"We are not sure how to interpret the CD2 (see , , ) with respect to the question as to what the correct initial positions of the write and read pointers of a stringstream should be."
"Is it the same to output two strings or to initialize the stringstream with the first and to output the second?"
discussion.note: PJ Plauger, Bjarne Stroustrup, Randy Smithey, Sean Corfield, and Jerry Schwarz have all offered opinions; see reflector messages lib-6518, 6519, 6520, 6521, 6523, 6524.

rationale.p: The LWG believes the Standard is correct as written. The behavior of stringstreams is consistent with fstreams, and there is a constructor which can be used to obtain the desired effect. This behavior is known to be different from strstreams.
